intro: Piper subsessililimbum, commonly known as the slender pipevine, is a tropical climbing plant belonging to the family Piperaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
